thread.section_title: Dallas Stars News - Sports News for Dallas, Texas
thread.title: Report: Texas police officer in trouble after taking pic with Cowboys RB Christine Michael
thread.title_full: Report: Texas police officer in trouble after taking pic with Cowboys RB Christine Michael | Dallas Morning News

author: Joshua Friemel
title: Report: Texas police officer in trouble after taking pic with Cowboys RB Christine Michael
text:
The Texas Highway Patrol trooper who pulled over a Dallas Cowboys running back and then took a picture with him -- will face disciplinary actions for the incident, TMZ Sports reported.
According to a representative of the Texas Highway Patrol, Michael's car was pulled over three hours before the game because it appeared his Bentley had illegal tint on the front windshield.
The trooper did not issue a ticket but took a photo with the player.
"The trooper's actions have been reviewed by DPS and are not consistent with department procedure," sergeant Lonny Haschel told TMZ. "Corrective action, in the form of a procedural review, will be taken. In conversations with his chain of command, the trooper realized his error in judgement and was apologetic for the incident."
Michael went on to play in the loss of the Patriots but had just one carry for six yards.
The running back posted the below photo on Instagram Sunday morning saying that he was pulled over to take a photo with the police officer.
Got stopped just to take a picture ...DDD
A photo posted by Christine Michael (@chrismike33) on Oct 11, 2015 at 10:56am PDT
At least Michael was a good enough sport to oblige. The pains of being a celebrity.
